page.title: 08WOODLAND DECIDUOUS COPPICE
page.content: In our square there is{SHEEPWASH FARM} and several copses owned by the Southwick Estate. These are{SHORT'S {COPPICE,WARD'S COPPICE}and{DUN'S LAND {COPPICE. }By Short's Coppice there is {WARD'S DROVES PLANTATION.} There are quiet country lanes which are narrow and twisting with hedges and deciduous trees between the roads and the fields. {GRAYS LAND LANE}got its name because it is near {GRAYS LAND HUMMOCK nearby. The land between the coppice and the main stream which runs into the pond in the grounds of H.M.S.Dryad is covered with a crop of assorted conifers. There is also rough ground on which grows an assortment of wild flowers.
